entry.title: It is time to materialize a Palestine state

media:group.media:title: It is time to materialize a Palestine state
media:group.media:description:
The world should expand all efforts that are needed to stop the war in the Gaza Strip, says Varsen Aghabekian, the Palestinian Minister of State for Foreign Affairs and Expatriates. At the 2025 Yerevan Dialogueshe emphasized that a peace agreement between Israel and Palestine will also help preserve the presence of ethnic groups in the region, including the Armenian community. The Foreign Minister warmly welcomed Armenia's decision to recognize the State of Palestine, calling it a wise step.

entry.title: Armenia can be a strategic gateway for India to Europe: Indian expert

media:group.media:title: Armenia can be a strategic gateway for India to Europe: Indian expert
media:group.media:description:
India has rapidly ascended to become Armenia's largest defense supplier, overtaking traditional partners in just three years. Dr. Swasti Rao, geopolitical expert and defense consultant to India's Ministry of Defense, reveals the remarkable transformation of Indo-Armenian defense cooperation and what it means for regional security. In this interview, held on May 26 on the sidelines of the Yerevan Dialogue diplomatic forum, she outlines key arms deals, Indiaâ€™s export ambitions, trilateral synergies with France and Greece, and the strategic value of Armenia as a trusted partner and regional gateway.

entry.title: From the Abraham Accords to India: Armeniaâ€™s Headlines Explained

media:group.media:title: From the Abraham Accords to India: Armeniaâ€™s Headlines Explained
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the CivilNet podcast, political analyst Eric Hacopian covers some of the major developments in Armenia this week. He addresses speculation around Yerevanâ€™s potential inclusion in the U.S.-brokered Abraham Accords and explores how the Trump administration may use the platform to reshape the South Caucasus. Hacopian also examines renewed efforts by Russia to reassert influence in Armenia, the political scuffles positioning former president Robert Kocharyan and his son Levon as the face of the opposition, and how rising tensions between India and Pakistan could have unexpected effects on Armenia.
